metadata.name: Uncommon Child Process Of Conhost.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects uncommon "conhost" child processes. This could be a sign of "conhost" usage as a LOLBIN or potential process injection activity.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\conhost.exe')) AND NOT (endswith(lower(process.name), lower(':\\windows\\system32\\conhost.exe')) OR process.name is null OR lower(process.name) = lower('')) AND NOT lower(metadata.log_provider) = lower('systemtraceprovider-process'))

output.summary: Detects uncommon "conhost" child processes. This could be a sign of "conhost" usage as a LOLBIN or potential process injection activity.
